intro: Garuleum album, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine downy texture. Garuleum album is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
